# STL — Semantic Tension Language

> For structured semantic content, see: /.well-known/site.stl

## About
STL (Semantic Tension Language) is a calculable, universal standard for structuring knowledge through directional semantic relations. It is human-readable, machine-executable, and LLM-native.

## Core Syntax
[Source] -> [Target] ::mod(confidence=0.9, rule="causal", source="reference")

## Key Resources
- Specification: https://github.com/scos-lab/semantic-tension-language
- Parser & Tools: https://github.com/scos-lab/STL-TOOLS (stl_parser v1.7.0, 530 tests)
- This Website: https://github.com/scos-lab/stl-web

## Tools
- stl_parser: Python parser (pip install stl-parser) — parse, validate, serialize, query, diff, stream
- CLI: stl validate/convert/analyze/build/query/diff/clean
- MCP: validate_stl, parse_stl, analyze_stl, validate_stl_file
- Schemas: TCM, Scientific, Causal, Historical, Medical, Legal

## Pages
- /about — STL language overview and design philosophy
- /tools — Complete tooling ecosystem
- /spec — Specification documents
- /aso — AI Search Optimization concept
- /demo — Interactive STL editor

## Documentation (35 pages)
- /docs — Documentation hub
- /docs/getting-started/installation — Install stl-parser
- /docs/getting-started/quickstart — Parse, build, validate first STL
- /docs/getting-started/key-concepts — Anchors, paths, modifiers, tension-path model
- /docs/tutorials/01-parsing — Parse STL text and files
- /docs/tutorials/02-building — Build statements programmatically
- /docs/tutorials/03-schema-validation — Validate against domain schemas
- /docs/tutorials/04-llm-pipeline — Clean and repair LLM output
- /docs/tutorials/05-querying — Query, filter, select statements
- /docs/tutorials/06-streaming-io — Read and write STL streams
- /docs/tutorials/07-diff-patch — Compare and patch documents
- /docs/tutorials/08-cli-tools — Command-line workflows
- /docs/guides/custom-schemas — Create domain-specific schemas
- /docs/guides/llm-integration — Use STL with ChatGPT, Claude, LLMs
- /docs/guides/knowledge-graph-pipeline — Build end-to-end knowledge graphs
- /docs/guides/event-logging — Structured event logging with STL
- /docs/guides/confidence-decay — Manage knowledge freshness over time
- /docs/reference/stl-syntax — One-page syntax quick reference
- /docs/reference/modifiers — All 30+ modifier fields
- /docs/reference/anchor-types — 9 canonical anchor types
- /docs/reference/cli — All 10 CLI commands
- /docs/reference/error-codes — E001-E969, W001-W099
- /docs/reference/api/parser — Parser API
- /docs/reference/api/models — Data models (Anchor, Statement, ParseResult)
- /docs/reference/api/builder — Fluent builder API
- /docs/reference/api/schema — Schema validation API

- /docs/reference/api/emitter — Event emitter API

- /docs/reference/api/reader — Streaming reader API
- /docs/reference/api/decay — Confidence decay API
- /docs/reference/api/serializer — Serialization API (JSON, RDF, STL)
- /docs/reference/api/graph — Graph analysis API
- /docs/schemas/README — Domain schema ecosystem overview

## AI-Native
This website is built with STL. All content is available as .stl files at /content/*.stl for direct AI consumption. See /.well-known/site.stl for the site manifest. Sitemap at /sitemap-index.xml.
